Package controller

Class AppointmentFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.AppointmentFilter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppointmentFilter.Monthly, AppointmentFilter.None, AppointmentFilter.Weekly
    public abstract class AppointmentFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class of filters for the appointments tab on the main window, also serving as a namespace for the different filters, implemented as subclasses. Each filter shows a subset (possibly the entire set) of appointments and allows for navigating to and from previous and subsequent subsets. Each of these subsets is a "view" of the set of appointments, such a the view of one week or one month of appointments.
    Author:
    Joseph T. Lapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  AppointmentFilter.Monthly
      Filter of appointments by month, showing one month at a time.
      static class  AppointmentFilter.None
      Filter that does not filter at all, resulting in a display of all appointments.
      static class  AppointmentFilter.Weekly
      Filter of appointments by week, showing one week at a time.

      • AppointmentFilter

        public AppointmentFilter​(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> allAppointments)
        Constructs an appointment filter for the provided list of appointments.
        Parameters:
        allAppointments - Appointments on which to base the filter

    • Method Detail

      • getSubtitle

        public abstract java.lang.String getSubtitle()
        Subtitle to show next to the scene title to indicate which appointments are being displayed. The subtitle for a filter may vary with the view's current position within all possible appointments.
        Returns:
        The subtitle for the active view

      • getFilteredList

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getFilteredList()
        Returns a list of appointments filtered for the current view.
        Returns:
        List of appointments filtered for the current view

      • hasNextView

        public abstract boolean hasNextView()
        Indicates whether subsequent views follow the current view. Used for determining whether to enable or disable view navigation buttons.
        Returns:
        Whether there is a subsequent view

      • hasPreviousView

        public abstract boolean hasPreviousView()
        Indicates whether preceding views follow the current view. Used for determining whether to enable or disable view navigation buttons.
        Returns:
        Whether there is a preceding view

      • nextView

        public abstract void nextView()
        Advances the filter to the next available view. Only call if hasNextView() reported an available view.

      • previousView

        public abstract void previousView()
        Advances the filter to the previous available view. Only call if hasPreviousView() reported an available view.

      • isInView

        protected abstract boolean isInView​(Appointment appointment)
        Tests whether the provided appointment is in the current view.
        Parameters:
        appointment - Appointment to test
        Returns:
        Whether the appointment is in the current view
